meanings.definition: An object or collection of objects wrapped in paper or other material and tied up for carrying or posting.
meanings.sent1: I received a small parcel in the mail today.
meanings.sent2: She carefully wrapped the gift in a colorful parcel.
meanings.sent3: The parcel was so big, it looked like a mini present mountain!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a parcel of joy in the room.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh cookies filled the room like a warm, comforting parcel.

meanings.sent1: The farmer owned a large parcel of land for growing crops.
meanings.sent2: They decided to build their house on a beautiful parcel near the river.
meanings.sent3: The parcel of land was so vast, it seemed to stretch on forever.
meanings.sent4: His dreams were tied to that small parcel of land.
meanings.sent5: The parcel of land was a patchwork of green fields under the blue sky.

meanings.definition: To divide into parts and distribute.
meanings.sent1: She had to parcel out the candies equally among the children.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to parcel the crayons among themselves.
meanings.sent3: He tried to parcel out the chores fairly, but some were not happy.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to parcel itself out differently when she was with him.
meanings.sent5: The team had to parcel their resources wisely to complete the project on time.
